review: A friend bought one of these to try out earlier in the summer. It's a great (and cheap) way to share a YouTube video (as well as watch a TV show or movie from one of the supported streaming sites). There's no security so it depends on the security of your network, but  it makes setup and use simpler. It has no playback performance issues that I can see (YouTube videos of varying quality, Hulu+ HD, Netflix HD). Playback works great both from an Android device and a Linux desktop. Highly recommended if you're looking for a cheap, small streaming set-top-"box"
author: Jesse B

review: Installation is so easy that you tend to make it hard.  I am casting from a tablet, a smart phone, and a laptop running Win 7.  It connected to my wireless network right away.  My primary reason for buying was to view videos on my computer on my HD TV.  I am using the Real Player Cloud app that has Chromecast compatibility.  Great picture quality.  Only had one problem.  The Chromecast device started dropping off the wireless network around the second week of use.  Researched user forum and found the answer to my problem was the USB cable that came with the device was faulty.  Installed new cable and have had zero signal drops since. Have viewed up to 5 hours of video straight without any problems
author: James L. Schaffner "Jim in CO"

review: This is a great idea. It's better than having a dedicated computer just for the HDTV. Anyone using a chrome browser can connect on Windows or Mac. Android users can use Netflix, Hulu, HBO GO, You Tube, Google Play Movies, and Google Play Music. I hear that there are more apps coming that are compatible with it. I have two of these now. One for my room and one for the living room. I may get another one to take with me for work to present web apps to my clients.

And being able to throw a youtube video up on the screen in a few seconds to show friends is cool and handy.I also want to give a shout-out to the shipping crew at amazon.
